alert.note: Alert for Bath; Breathitt; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Magoffin; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, Menifee, Lee, Fleming, Rowan, Wolfe, Powell, Morgan, Bath, central Estill, northwestern Breathitt, northwestern Magoffin and Elliott Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1015 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Maysville to Crooks to Wagersville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Marshall, Olympia Springs, Olympia, Rothwell, Cornwell, Polksville and Peasticks around 1020 PM EDT. Frenchburg, Salt Lick, Sudith, Young Springs, Ratlitt, Greeley, Midland and See around 1025 PM EDT. Beattyville, Mount Olive, Scranton, Proctor, Maloney, Yale, Fixer, Zoe, Cogswell and Whisman around 1030 PM EDT. Fincastle, Wellington, Airedale, Primrose, St. Helens, Big Woods, Monica, Vada, Bangor and Dan around 1035 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Henry, Zag, Fillmore, Widecreek, Canyon Falls, Blaze, Yocum, Williba, Athol, Dehart, West Liberty, War Creek, Lawson, Gentry, Wrigley, Yeadon, Pomp, Frozen Creek, Chenowee, Pence, Jackson, Simpson, Steele, Lenox, Fivemile, Inverness, Elkatawa, Lick Branch, Keck, Dumont, Haginsville, Elkfork, Crockett, Noctor, Portsmouth, Jeptha, Smith Branch, Wilstacy, Stevenson and Press. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Breathitt; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Magoffin; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe
